section: unit of: resistance is the Ohm
content: (1) Resistance = V/I. (1) The unit of resistance is the Ohm[Ω]. It must offer no resistance to (1) current flow - the circuit must function as if the ammeter is not in (1) the circuit. 1/R = 1/R + 1/R + 1/R (1) T 1 2 3 1/R = ½ + ½ + ½ T 1/R = 3/2 T R = 2/3Ω or 0.67 Ω (1) T (1) V = IR I = V/R = (1) (1) R = 3Ω + 0.67Ω = 3.67Ω T (1) I = 3V/3.67Ω (1) = 0.82A (1)
content_items: (1) Resistance = V/I. (1) The unit of resistance is the Ohm[Ω]. It must offer no resistance to (1) current flow - the circuit must function as if the ammeter is not in (1) the circuit. 1/R = 1/R + 1/R + 1/R (1) T 1 2 3 1/R = ½ + ½ + ½ T 1/R = 3/2 T R = 2/3Ω or 0.67 Ω (1) T (1) V = IR I = V/R = (1) (1) R = 3Ω + 0.67Ω = 3.67Ω T (1) I = 3V/3.67Ω (1) = 0.82A (1)

section: unit of: resistance is the Ohm
content: For propagation of transverse waves, the displacement of the medium is perpendicular to the direction of motion while for propagation of longitudinal waves, the displacement of the medium is parallel to the propagation of the wave. Examples: transverse wave - electromagnetic / water waves Longitudinal wave - sound waves Wavelength: The distance between successive crests or troughs of a wave Frequency: Number of waves per unit time Amplitude: This is the maximum displacement of the wave displacement (cm) 2 4 6 8 10 12 distance(cm) 1 mark for general sinusoidal shape 1 mark for crossing at 3 cm and ending on 6 cm Frequency = Number of waves / time = 1 / 4 f = 0.25 /seconds (1) (1) (1) marks for equation, substitution, correct answer Amplitude of the wave = 4 cm (1) Example in medical testing: ultrasound in prenatal care (1) Example in industry: testing of materials for defects (1)
content_items: For propagation of transverse waves, the displacement of the medium is perpendicular to the direction of motion while for propagation of longitudinal waves, the displacement of the medium is parallel to the propagation of the wave. Examples: transverse wave - electromagnetic / water waves Longitudinal wave - sound waves Wavelength: The distance between successive crests or troughs of a wave Frequency: Number of waves per unit time Amplitude: This is the maximum displacement of the wave displacement (cm) 2 4 6 8 10 12 distance(cm) 1 mark for general sinusoidal shape 1 mark for crossing at 3 cm

ending on 6 cm Frequency = Number of waves / time = 1 / 4 f = 0.25 /seconds (1) (1) (1) marks for equation, substitution, correct answer Amplitude of the wave = 4 cm (1) Example in medical testing: ultrasound in prenatal care (1) Example in industry: testing of materials for defects (1)
